item.title: Middle eastern red lentil soup
item.description: Originally from Kate and Lynne, this recipe depends on red lentils (not green lentils) and generally can be made with ingredients already in stock in our house. Serve with pita and labneh (if you can manage to not eat all of the pita and labneh before dinner), and with a chopped green salad with a sumac vinagrette. Middle Eastern Red Lentil Soup 1 medium yellow onion chopped 2 cloves of garlic, minced or pressed 1 T olive oil 1 and 1/2 C red lentils (NOT brown) 8 C water 1 t salt fresh ground pepper 1 T ground cumin lemon juice, to taste In a big pot, saute the onion and garlic in the olive oil until the onion is soft.
